posts.author: DatCatAntimony
posts.content:
Since I havn't seen other builds going a dex route with this split and picking up SC5, I thought I'd post this up. It's meant to be a PvP build first and foremost, able to survive and outlast opponents with chip damage and offer fairly strong sneaks attacks on flat fooded targets.
While it's DC's are low on the server I play on anyone can have access to mind immunity or paralyzation immunity, making the actual fear part of the rage rather useless. It's debuff of -2 AB and buff of +2 AB/Damage as well as temporary HP of 240 however quite valuable. With access to UMD and wands of invisibility it can score cheap shots with sneaks or dispel buff reliant combatants.
Rogue was chosen over SD for the sneak attacks and UMD, required to access said wands. Blind fight can be substituted for Improved Critical, but with all the easy access concealment of Improved Invis, Concealment or SCI-V, Darkness and similar I largely prefer Blind Fight over a 10% higher crit chance.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
The build looks good.
Is this made for your server where rage gives a bonus to AB rather than strength? If so, it makes sense with dexer barbarian. If not, I don't know.
The build is for PvP. How high level of magical items can you get? This kind of dexers with ED, SC5 and 6-7 attacks per round are better in high magic environments where you get all damage from weapon enhancements and build to survive a battle of 20s.
You should also mention the 40% xp penalty.
Edit: How about picking halfling with daggers rather than elf for +1 to AB and AC and only 20% xp penalty?

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Some disclosure for those interested in following this build...

Alignment restriction: any unlawful
-20% XP penalty from Lvl 16-19 and then -40% XP penalty from Lvl 20 to 40.  This is probably why you haven't seen a build like this posted.  Players need to level faster to hold onto their interest.

It's not a bad build per se.  It's just hasn't been optimized... and probably better posted in the unfinished section until all the bugs have been worked out and play-tested through Level 40 somewhere.  You would also be better off itemizing all the "tweaks" where you play so others who may be considering your build for their own venue are alerted to those aspects. I suspect that this design will only have much value in high-magic realms with lots of high level item properties.

First off, the weakness listed is not "No WF/EWF" but rather "No WS/EWS" for a fighter.  You could simply insert CoT, gain +2 saves at the cost of a feat but at least the XP penalty would be more digestible.

Ummm... you do realize Dodge is not a prereq for Epic Dodge, right?  I don't consider Dodge itself to have much value in this build with other more important issues at hand.

Any ranks over 40 for UMD is totally worthless. And in most environments (those not offering insanely expensive class-specific gear), 33 modified ranks is adequate to use all scrolls and other casting items.  You could slide the excess over to your slightly-pedestrian stealth skill and max it, for example.
